moves.1. e4:
so rarely happens in chess. a real underdog result. the last thing i expected when i was playing a 2200 rating was a victory.

anyhoo.. a kings pawn opening..
moves.4. Bb5: i like this as it's all about the lines.
moves.4... Bb4: i've seen this move somewhere before... in fact i was wondering if he was just toying with me here setting me up for a humiliating defeat.
moves.5. Bxc6:
so i thought i'd better draw first blood and get some points on the board. 


and it also gives him the problem of doubled up pawns..
moves.5... dxc6: which is of course what happened.
moves.6. Nxe5: and a lack of concentration left me his pawn. i wonder if he is giving this game his full concentration yet?
moves.7. f4: i think this is bold and leaves my knight in an attacking space and none of this running away lark he might have been hoping for.
moves.7... Bxc3: now i think he is getting desperate..
moves.8. dxc3: i think i'm in a much better position after this exchange.
moves.9. O-O: time to castle. i still like the way it's turning out.
moves.9... O-O: got him scared. he wastes a move to defend himself.
moves.10. Re1: this is looking nice for me. a long way to go yet though...
moves.10... f5: i still don't think he is giving this game proper attention...
moves.12... Rad8: this takes a turn for the worse. i don't know where to go from here and i think i'm in an elaborate trap i've never seen before...
moves.13. Red1: so time to make a stand..
moves.14. a4: it's getting complicated. note i can't take the pawn on a7 with my bishop as it would be trapped with a b7 to b6 pawn move.
moves.15. Bxa7: but i've seen something. have you spotted it?
moves.17. Nd4: but i'm still 2 pawns up and think i'm looking good.
moves.18. a5: and i need to do likewise for mine
moves.19. axb6: a brilliant move. now he is in a world of pain.
moves.19... cxb6: take back that irritatingly advanced pawn.
moves.20. Bxb6: and this has opened up multiple attacks.
moves.21. Rxa8+: and i get his rook and check to boot.
moves.21... Kf7: now i'm five points up. i'm starting to think 2200 rating or not, i've got a chance here.
moves.22. Qh5+: all about the lines. and it's the start of the end for black.
moves.22... Ke7 23. Qxh7: another free pawn. i'm right in behind now. what has black got left in the locker?
moves.23... Qf6: a bit of fight. he was on a 20 match winning streak and did not want to give it up without a fight. this is real backs to the wall for black. there is zero threat being posed to the white king here.
moves.24. Qg8: all i need it to pressure a mistake but there are multiple check mate options open now.
moves.24... Bb5: and there is the mistake. no need to push home a victory from here...
moves.25. Qxd5:
as this is where the towel was thrown in.

so any 1300-1500 players out there. 

you can do it if i did it! 

good luck!
